CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Article 9 - Freedom of thought conscience and religion (Article 9-1 - Manifest religion or belief);Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra;Mihai Poalelungi
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant is a GPE ’s Witness . From DATE he attended various GPE ’s Witnesses religious services .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was registered as a person liable for military service with ORG . Because the applicant was studying at the university , his military service was postponed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant received notice to appear at the military commissariat to report for military service .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant wrote a letter to the Malatia - Sebastia District Military Commissariat , stating that he would not report for military service and requesting that his case be sent to ORG . The applicant also informed ORG in writing that he refused to perform military service because of his religious beliefs but was willing to perform alternative civilian service .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Shahumyan Military Commissar wrote to the relevant police station about the applicant ’s refusal to report for military service , asking that he be forcibly brought to the military commissariat .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant made a statement at the police station , explaining that he refused to perform military service because of his religious beliefs but was willing to perform alternative civilian service .
CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG of GPE informed the applicant that he would face criminal charges if he failed to report for military service .
CARDINAL . On DATE criminal proceedings were instituted under LAW of LAW on account of the applicant ’s draft evasion .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was questioned at ORG of GPE . He once again submitted that he was refusing to serve in the army for religious reasons but was prepared to perform alternative civilian service .
CARDINAL . On DATE LOC of GPE ordered that the applicant be detained on remand .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE found the applicant guilty of draft evasion and sentenced him to DATE in prison .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant lodged an appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal , arguing , inter alia , that his conviction violated his rights guaranteed by LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the applicant ’s conviction .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was released on parole after having served DATE and DATE of his sentence .
CARDINAL . For a summary of the relevant domestic provisions see the judgment in the case of PERSON v. GPE ( [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
